page.title: 16PLANS TO DEVELOP STONEHENGE
page.content: There has been growing dissatisfaction among visitors to Stonehenge with the way that the site is presented to them. In 1984 a commission was set up to look into the future development and preservation of the site. The Stonehenge Study Group in conjunction with English Heritage published a report in 1985 showing several plans and options for improving the facilities within and around the Monument. One proposal put forward was for a series of visitors' centres strategically placed to give the visitor a clear view of the monument and an opportunity to see parts of the surrounding area in context. The significance of the round barrows and earthworks and the Cursus could then be made apparent.
